document_data.name: Phlan Path
document_data.mainbody: The '''Phlan Path''' was the road along the northern coast of the [[Moonsea (lake)|Moonsea]] lake that connected the cities of [[Phlan]] and [[Melvaunt]].{{Cite dungeon/170/Monument of the Ancients|56}}
document_data.Description: While it was one of the most well-developed roads along the northern coast of the sea, for some stretches it was merely a well-trodden dirt path.
document_data.Geography:
The Phlan path intersected with the [[Iron Route]] at the bank of the [[Stojanow River]] near Phlan.{{Cite adventurers league/Tyranny in Phlan|28}}

Traveling east from Phlan, the path intercepted the termination of [[Toranth's March]], the southbound trail from [[Castle Vathar]], before intersecting the [[Trank River]] at a lone bridge crossing. It wound through the [[Moonwatch Hills]] before finally reaching Melvaunt.{{Cite adventurers league/Drums in the Marsh|7}}{{Cite adventurers league/Outlaws of the Iron Route|33}}
document_data.History:
In the {{YearlinkName|1373}}, group of [[bandit]]s operating along the Phlan Path slew a lone [[ogre]] ravager traveling down from [[Thar]]. The ogre carried a unique obelisk made of [[jade]], that was in fact the key that could open up the [[Tomb of Vorbyx]].

Highwaymen continued to plague the road even a century later, as the [[Merchant's Guild]] of Phlan suffered a number of robberies along that stretch of the [[Moonsea North]].{{Cite adventurers league/Raiders of the Twilight Marsh|7}}
document_data.Rumors & Legends: Around that same time rumors circulated that [[orc]]s were assaulting people that traveled along the Phlan Path.
document_data.Notable Locations: * [[Crossing Inn]], a stopover establishment located on the south side of the path on the east bank of the Trank River.>
